comments:
ServerNotAvailableException when launching a test in the same workbench session after security is disabled in the Agent Controller.

After launching a TPTP test (e.g. manual or JUnit) on a target host that is running an Agent Controller with security enabled (for example, Windows XP --> Linux IA32), restarting hte Agent Controller with security disabled and launching the exact same test using the same run configuration, causes the following exception:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: IWAT4039E The Test Execution Harness reported the following problems:java.lang.NullPointerExceptionorg.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.ServerNotAvailableException: java.lang.NullPointerException

Session Data:

eclipse.buildId=I20060519-1206
java.fullversion=J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Windows XP x86-32 j9vmwi3223ifx-20060124 (JIT enabled)
J9VM - 20051027_03723_lHdSMR
JIT  - 20051027_1437_r8
GC   - 20051020_AA
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -clean -data D:\AC_Hyades_WSAD_Drivers\TPTP-4.2.0-200605290100\eclipse\workspace

Closing and restarting the workbench resolves the problem since the workbench caches the connection to the target host (e.g. secure vs. insecure) despite the Agent Controller on the remote host being reconfigured and restarted.
Targeting 4.3 for this.  I'm not sure if this is normal severity or minor, depends upon user expectations for this particular scenario of configuration changes.

I'd like to see this considered for 4.2 i4.  Now that we support secure AC, this defect is not too difficult to trip over, and the error message gives no indication as to the reason for the failure or how to correct it.
Retargeting to 4.2.1 based on conversation with Joe.  Didn't target to 4.2 i4 because defect severity (as currently understood) didn't justify it.  Assigning to Joe Toomey.

As a result of the workbench caching the connection to the target host (e.g. secure vs. insecure), the following exception is thrown when launching a test via the Agent Controller with security enabled AFTER removing the security certificate from the Agent Controller preference
dialog (Window >> Preferences >> Agent Controller):

Not going to be able to contain this in 4.2.1 -- moving to 4.3
Per AG call on 10/20, all non-blocking/non-critical defects are to be retargeted to 4.4.
Targeting to future since cannot be contained in 4.4.
Targeting to future since cannot be contained in 4.4.

As discussed on this week's Test Project call (January 22, 2007), the Test Project will focus on existing P1 - P2/Blocker - Major and P1/Normal and test creation/automation defects (omitting defects dependant on outstanding features) in TPTP 4.4.  All other Test Project defects have been targeted to future.

If this defect has been targeted to future and you/originator feel it should be completed in 4.4, please provide the necessary reason as a reply to this comment or a post to the Test Project mailing list (tptp-test-tooling-dev@eclipse.org).  We will collectively triage and assess our resources to determine a case-by-case decision.
